docs.snippet: Two-time overall World Cup champion Anna Veith is skipping the season-opening giant slalom in Soelden next Saturday.

headline.print_headline: 2-Time Overall Champ Veith Postpones Comeback From Injury
headline.main: 2-Time Overall Champ Veith Postpones Comeback From Injury

docs.snippet: British lawmakers on Thursday demanded that social media do more to police users who promote extremism, arguing that companies like Google, Facebook and Twitter are "consciously failing" to stop radicalization online.

headline.print_headline: UK Lawmakers Urge Social Media Companies to Tackle Extremism
headline.main: UK Lawmakers Urge Social Media Companies to Tackle Extremism

docs.snippet: Marc Lacey, a deputy national editor at The Times, and the critic at large Wesley Morris talk about the aftermath of the fatal shooting by a police officer in a St. Paul suburb that was caught on Facebook Live.

headline.main: A Discussion About the Minnesota Video

docs.snippet: Singapore Airlines said on Saturday it has banned Samsung's Galaxy Note 7 mobile phones from all its flights and any passenger carrying one will not be allowed to board its planes.

headline.print_headline: Singapore Airlines Bans Samsung Galaxy Note 7 on Its Flights
headline.main: Singapore Airlines Bans Samsung Galaxy Note 7 on Its Flights

docs.snippet: Snapchat started in 2011 as an app through which people could send messages that would disappear. Now it has many features and a large user base.

headline.print_headline: How Snapchat Is Shaping Social Media
headline.main: How Snapchat Is Shaping Social Media

docs.snippet: A school bus overturned in southeast Texas, on Friday, injuring more than a dozen students and the driver, the local sheriff and school district said.

headline.print_headline: School Bus Overturns Near Houston, Injuring 14
headline.main: School Bus Overturns Near Houston, Injuring 14

docs.snippet: The city has developed clever ways to reuse excess heat from unconventional sources like household wastewater.

headline.print_headline: Wastewater Is Heating Pools in Paris
headline.main: If the Pool Is Warm in Paris, Thank the Washing Machine

docs.snippet: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says a resolution adopted by the U.N. cultural agency denies the Jewish connection to holy sites in Jerusalem and is a "theatre of the absurd."

headline.print_headline: Israeli Leader Blasts UN Resolution on Jerusalem
headline.main: Israeli Leader Blasts UN Resolution on Jerusalem
